page.title: 12ECOLOGY - HEDGEROWS
page.content: THE{HEDGEROWS}OF THIS AREA ARE VERY ABUNDANT BUT NOT AS ABUNDANT AS THEY USED TO BE. FARMERS AROUND THE AREA HAVE THINNED OUT MOST HEDGEROWS FOR EASIER ACCESS TO FIELDS WHICH ALSO MAKES MACHINERY MOVEMENT EASIER. THE HEDGEROWS STILL STANDING ARE IN GOOD HEALTH HOWEVER. IN THE{1950'S}AND EARLIER, TO THIN OUT HEDGEROWS WAS NOT NECESSARY. AS THE MACHINERY WAS VERY LIMITED, TO HAVE LARGE FIELDS THE TOP SOIL WOULD EASILY BE BLOWN AWAY BUT WITH THE MODERN MACHINERY AND HAVING FERTILIZERS THIS IS PREVENTED. SOME HEDGEROWS ARE OVERGROWN, THIS GIVES INCREASED WILDLIFE AND MANY BIRDS ARE INCREASING IN NUMBERS DUE TO THE FACT THAT THE NEARBY FARMERS HAVE NOT THINNED OUT ANY MORE HEDGEROWS.{ { BY:RICHARD DENNETT
